Minister.Text: Introduced by President of the Treasury Board

Item.Text: — ss. 1 and 262 to 283 in force on assent 07.11.2003;
— ss. 14, 19, the definitions “amended Act”, “former Act”, “former Commission” and “new Commission” in s. 68, ss. 77 to 83 and 246 to 250 in force 20.11.2003 see SI/2003-178;
— preamble, ss. 1 to 3 and Part 1 (ss. 4 to 205) of the Public Service Labour Relations Act, as enacted by s. 2, in force 01.04.2005 see SI/2005-22;

— Part 2 (ss. 206 to 238) other than subpar. 209(1)(c)(ii), par. 211(b) and s. 231 of the Public Service Labour Relations Act, as enacted by s. 2, in force 01.04.2005 see SI/2005-23; subpar. 209(1)(c)(ii), par. 211(b) and s. 231 of the Public Service Labour Relations Act, as enacted by s. 2, in force 31.12.2005 see SI/2005-123
— Parts 3 (ss. 239 and 240) and 4 (ss. 241 to 252) of the Public Service Labour Relations Act, as enacted by s. 2, in force 01.04.2005 see SI/2005-24;
— ss. 36 to 66 and 88 to 226 in force 01.04.2005 see SI/2005-24;
— repeal of the Public Service Staff Relations Act, R.S., c. P-35, 31.03.2005 see s. 285 and SI/2005-21
— repeal of the Public Service Employment Act, R.S., c. P‑33, 30.12.2005 see s. 284 and SI/2005-121

— s. 12 (ss. 1 to 136 of the Public Service Employment Act, as enacted by s. 12) and s. 13 (schedule to the Public Service Employment Act, as enacted by s. 12), and the definition “new Act” in s. 68, ss. 69 to 76 and 227 to 245 in force 31.12.2005 see SI/2005-122
— ss. 15 to 18, 20 and 84 repealed before coming into force 31.12.2013 see 2008, c. 20, s. 3 (Statutes Repeal Act);
